result.execSummary:
All charges against Nathanael R. Benton in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathanael R. Benton is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:11 PM Defendant Nathanael R. Benton in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen in court for Nathanael R. Benton.  Attorney Susan L. Opper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
All parties are ready to proceed to sentencing today. 
State moves to dismiss matter. 
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses matter.
Status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:27 AM Defendant Nathanael R. Benton in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   DA Susan L. Opper and ADA Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
21CF1999 is called for a Motion Hearing and Jury Status.
22CF1009 is called for Motion Hearing. 
20CF1666 called as a tagalong.

State has filed a Motion for Joinder on 7/06/22. 
The Court addresses the Motion for Joinder with 22CF1009 on the record.
The Court denies the Motion for Joinder.

This case will tagalong for trial in 21CF1999.
State's Witness List
Defendant's Response To Motion for Joinder.
Motion hearing on July 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Notice of Motion, Motion for Joinder filed by the State

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on July 6, 2022: Set a hearing on 7/19 before Branch 2. Branch 2 will confer with Branch 10. Attorney Jensen to file a written response no later than 7/15.**

records.addlTxt: Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:26 AM Defendant Nathanael R. Benton in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Sheriff's Deputy Chad Stenulson, of the Waukesha County Sheriffs Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Sitzberger.
Cross examination by attorney Jensen.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.

12:59 PM Defendant Nathanael R. Benton in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen by zoom video.   Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Attorney Jeff Jensen Sr. has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Hearing on June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:16 PM Defendant Nathanael R. Benton in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney Sue Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Law Intern states Atty. Jeffery Jensen senior is going to be appointed on this case.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Atty. Jensen can appear by zoom for the next hearing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on June 16, 2022
Hearing on June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of their professional capacity or if Victim A initiates contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:14 PM Defendant Nathanael R. Benton in court, in custody.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The State is asking to set this matter back for status of counsel.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
